sentence.text: osteoblast differentiation expression is absent in normal urothelial cells, but it begins to be expressed in pre-neoplastic bladder tumors and continues to be expressed in invasive mouse BCa.

Ablation of osteoblast differentiation-expressing cells within primary invasive intracellular signal transduction led to enhanced tumor regression, supporting the essential role of SOX2-positive cells in regulating BCa maintenance and progression.
Using s as a reporter of Sox2 transcriptional expression, we demonstrated that Sox2-expressing cells protein phosphorylation a subpopulation of tumor cells that fuel the growth of established BCa.
